description.narrative: The Georgia II compact sought to increase the earning potential of Georgians through improvements in the quality of education in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) fields, including strategic investments in general education, technical training and advanced degree programs. The compact also aimed to increase women?s participation in STEM professions. MCC?s partnership with Georgia is a strong example of how the U.S. government promotes economic growth, helps people lift themselves out of poverty and invests in future generations around the world. Through this $140 million grant, the next generation of Georgians will be enabled to enter the workforce with the skills needed to make Georgia a more prosperous and stable country.

Upgrading STEM Education at Universities in Georgia

condition.narrative: A CIF procurement plan acceptable to MCC
A certificate of the Government (or MCA-Georgia), dated as of the date of the CIF Disbursement Request, in such form as provided by MCC
A completed Disbursement Request, together with the applicable Periodic Reports, for the applicable Disbursement Period, all in accordance with the Reporting Guidelines
An interim fiscal accountability plan acceptable to MCC

Appointment of an Procurement Director of MCA-Georgia, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of a Procurement Operations Manual, duly executed and in full force and effect

Appointment of an entity or individual to provide fiscal agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of a Fiscal Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the fiscal agent engaged thereby is mobilized

For any CIF Disbursement occurring after this Compact has entered into force in accordance with Article 7: MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (i) MCC has received copies of any reports due from any technical consultants (including environmental auditors engaged by MCA-Georgia) for any Activity since the previous Disbursement Request, and all such reports are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC; (ii) the Implementation Plan Documents and Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such CIF Disbursement; (iii) there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program or relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period); (iv) there has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with this Compact and the Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require); (v) MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, the Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate or the Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified; and (vi) if any of the officers or key staff of MCA-Georgia have been removed or resigned and the position remains vacant, MCA-Georgia is actively engaged in recruiting a replacement

For any CIF Disbursement occurring after this Compact has entered into force in accordance with Article 7: MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (i) MCC has received copies of any reports due from any technical consultants (including environmental auditors engaged by MCA-Georgia) for any Activity since the previous Disbursement Request, and all such reports are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC; (ii) the Implementation Plan Documents and Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such CIF Disbursement; (iii) there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program or relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period); (iv) there has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with this Compact and the Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require); (v) MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, the Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate or the Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified; and (vi) if any of the officers or key staff of MCA-Georgia have been removed or resigned and the position remains vacant, MCA-Georgia is actively engaged in recruiting a replacement
I1. PIA?3.3 (a) Compact has entered into force in accordance to article 7 of Compact.
I2. PIA?3.3 (b) Each of the Officers have been selected and engaged by MCA-G and approved by MCC.
I3. PIA?3.3 (c) MCA-G has developed a Fiscal Accountability Plan (or an Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan) and a Plan has been approved by MCC.
I4. PIA?3.3 (d) MCA-G has made substantial progress as determined by MCC in developing an M&E Plan.
I5. PIA?3.3 (e) MCA-G has developed a Complete Implementation Plan-work plan, audit plan, procurement plan, detailed financial plan.
I6. PIA?3.3 (f) Board has adopted bylaws and such bylaws has been approved by MCC.
II1. PIA?3.4 (a) Deliverables (i) Complete Disbursement Request together with Periodic reports covering the related disbursement period.

II10. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (v) There has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program, relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period).

II11. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (vi) All Government entities involved in the implementation of the Program, including the Implementing Entities, are coordinating successfully with MCA-Georgia and dedicating the necessary staff and other resources to ensure successful implementation of the Program.

II12. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (vii) There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require).

II13. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (viii) Any Taxes paid with MCC Funding for which a request for reimbursement has been made through the date ninety (90) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8(c) of the Compact.

II14. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (ix) The Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, PIA and any other Supplemental Agreement.

II15. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (x) MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate or Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified.

II16. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (xi) No act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, the Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of the Compact.
II17. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (xii) Each of the Officers remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Georgia is actively engaged, to MCC's satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement.

II18. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (xiii) MCA-Georgia has complied in all material respects with its obligations (a)set forth in Section 2.1(d) with respect to the establishment of a BCS and (b) its obligations set forth in Section 2.3 with respect to the establishment of an M&E Plan.

II19. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (xiv) The Government has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in Section 2.12 with respect to the making of its contributions in accordance with the projected timeline set forth in Schedule 3. (anticipated government contributions).
II2. PIA?3.4 (a) Deliverables (ii) Copies of any reports from any technical auditors (environmental) engaged by MCA-G for any activity delivered since the previous Disbursement Request
II3. PIA?3.4 (a) Deliverables (iii) Certificate of MCA-G dated as of the date of such disbursement substantially in a form provided by MCC (MCA-G Disbursement Certificate).
II4. PIA?3.4 (a) Deliverables (iv) Certificate of Procurement Director substantially in a form provided by MCC (Procurement Director Disbursement Certificate).
II5. PIA?3.4 (a) Deliverables (v) Certificate of Fiscal Agent (Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate).
II6. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (i) All applicable conditions precedent in Schedule 2 of PIA have been duly satisfied, deferred or waived as provided in PIA.

II7. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (ii) No material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Georgia or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the Compact, PIA or any other Supplemental Agreement.
II8. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (iii) The activities to be funded with such Disbursement will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

II9. PIA?3.4 (b) Deliverables (iv) The Implementation Plan Documents and Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such Disbursement.
III1. PIA Schedule 2 1. CPs to all projects (a) Prior to 2nd Disbursement of Program Funding MCA-G must have developed Social and Gender Integration Plan in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

III2. PIA Schedule 2 1. CPs to all projects (b) Prior to Initial Disbursement PF for payments under particular works or construction contract for any Project or Activity MCA-G must have submitted to MCC following: ESMS, ESIA, EMP, ESMF, RPF/RAP.

III3. PIA Schedule 2 1. CPs to all projects (c) Prior to each Disbursement of Program Funding for payments under particular works or construction contract for any Project or Activity MCA-G must have submitted to MCC evidence that MCA-G or GoG entity is successfully implementing ESMS, ESIA, EMP, ESMF, RPF/RAP as appropriate and is in compliance with MCC environmental guidelines, IFC Performance Standards, MCC Gender Policy and Gender integration guidelines.
If a Fiscal Agent has been engaged, a Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate
If a Procurement Agent has been engaged, a Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate

If any proceeds of the CIF Disbursement are to be deposited in a bank account, MCC has received satisfactory evidence that (i) the Bank Agreement has been executed and (ii) the Permitted Accounts have been established

MCC has not determined, in its sole discretion, that an act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, the Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of this Compact

MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (i) the activities being funded with such CIF Disbursement are necessary, advisable or otherwise consistent with the goal of facilitating the implementation of the Compact and will not violate any applicable law or regulation; (ii) no material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Georgia or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under this Compact or any Supplemental Agreement; (iii) there has been no violation of, and the use of requested funds for the purposes requested will not violate, the limitations on use or treatment of MCC Funding set forth in Section 2.7 of this Compact or in any applicable law or regulation; (iv) any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date 90 days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8(c) of this Compact; and (v) the Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under this Compact and any Supplemental Agreement
